Content.Text:
<FACE_FRITZ><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
<MYNAME>, congrats on the win! Man, it's like
I'm not even in your league!
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>I'm still gonna be the world's greatest farmer --
who can also cook! -- someday, though. You're
gonna be a tough rival to beat!

<FACE_FRITZ><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Hmmm...Oh, hey <MYNAME>! Congrats on the
win. Hrm? I look worried?
<PAGE>
Nah, I'm not really worried. I was just thinkin'
how you're wasted on a guy like me.
<PAGE>
Folks have sometimes told me you're way outta
my league, and after seeing how you won today,
it's hard to dispute it.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>Guess I'm gonna have to work harder to be a
guy who can stand tall beside you. I'll do it, too!
Just you watch!

<FACE_FRITZ><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Great job, <MYNAME>. Congrats on the win!
<PAGE>
Heh heh. I know better than anyone how
awesome your cooking is. I'm darn lucky to have
such a great cook for a wife. ♪
<PAGE>
Still, I'd better take a page from your book and
get better at cooking myself. Nowadays, real
men know their way around a kitchen!

<FACE_FRITZ><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Great job, <MYNAME>. Today sure was a lot of
fun, wasn't it?
<PAGE>
Results are important, yeah, but it's just as
important to remember to have fun! I'm already
lookin' forward to next time! ♪

<FACE_FRITZ><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Great job, <MYNAME>. Hn? You look kinda
down. Is it 'cause you didn't win?
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>It's not like this is the last contest ever, y'know.
The important thing is to have fun, so you leave
with a smile.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LOVE>But if you're really, really sad, I'll fling my arms
wide open so you can jump into 'em for a big
consolation hug!
<PAGE>
<FACE_LOSS>W-wait, why are you laughing? I really meant it!
Oh well...looks like you've cheered up, and that's
what's important.

<FACE_FRITZ><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Great job, <MYNAME>. Hmm? Are you
depressed you didn't win?
<PAGE>
Yeah, losing sucks, no way around that. But I
know way better than those judges, or anybody,
just how hard you tried.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>You're one of those types, y'know? Those
uhh...whatchacallit...late boomers? It's those
kinds of people who get good later on!
<PAGE>
<FACE_LOSS>Huh? The way I said it makes it sound like a kind
of firework? Well, sorry I can't rattle off a turn of
phrase! Hey...you can stop laughing now!

<FACE_FRITZ><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Woohoo! I did it! I won! Now I'm one step -- no,
a hundred steps! -- closer to my goal of being
the world's greatest farmer who can cook! ♪

<FACE_FRITZ><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LOVE>
<MYNAME>, I did it! I won! So yeah, remember
how I told you that, if I won, there was
something important I was gonna tell you?
<PAGE>
<FACE_SAD>What? You don't remember? Didn't I mention it
to you when I was over at your place last night?
<PAGE>
You never saw me last night? Wait, was that all
just a dream?! Arrrrgh! My plans! All my plans!
N-no...it's nothing at all... Dang it.

<FACE_FRITZ><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Woohoo! I won! Heh heh heh! It's only right that
I get to show off how awesome a husband I am
every now and then. ♪
<PAGE>
Oh, I know! How about we have a big dinner
tonight, in celebration? I'll prove to you I didn't
just win on a lark!

<FACE_FRITZ><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LOSS>
Dang it, I was really confident I'd win this time.
Just what about my entry wasn't good enough?
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL>Oh well. The past is the past. I'll just have to win
next time!

<FACE_FRITZ><POS_RIGHT><FACE_SAD>
Dang it! My plan to show off how awesome I
can be by winning today and then making you
fall for me even more is ruined!
<PAGE>
Everything played out perfectly in my head, too,
but none of it works if I don't actually win!
Arrrrrgh.

<FACE_FRITZ><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
It stinks that I lost, but I can live with it, 'cause I
know how good of a cook you are.
<PAGE>
<FACE_ANGRY>But I totally don't wanna lose to anybody else!
And I really, really don't wanna see you lose to
anybody else, either!
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>So my new idea is for us both to finish first and
second every time from now on! It'd be nice if
we could take turns winning, too.

<FACE_FRITZ><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I think you get better results with the single
dishes instead of the full-course stuff, since you
can focus on making just one thing.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LOSS>If you've gotta worry about making a bunch of
things, you get tempted to take shortcuts to
make sure you finish everything.
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL>So if making a full course meal is gonna be that
much of a hassle, you've got a better shot if you
concentrate on one great dish.

<FACE_FRITZ><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I wonder how people decide what dish they're
gonna make.
<PAGE>
Hmm? Me? Oh, I just throw together whatever's
handy. I don't really have the extra money to buy
a whole bunch of fancy specialty ingredients!
<PAGE>
Basically, I take whatever I've grown in my own
fields and whatever gifts I've gotten from others
and make something from that.

<FACE_FRITZ><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Man, why do they have to bring out the full-
course dishes only one at a time like that?
<PAGE>
Don't you think it'd be way more impressive if
they just brought everything out at once, like,
shazzam!
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>I mean, if they did that, you get to see just how
much you get to eat, all at once! That'd make it
way easier to judge! ♪

<FACE_FRITZ><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Whoa...it all looks so good! ♪
<PAGE>
<FACE_LOSS>Only being able to look is really hard, though. It's
no fair that the judge gets to eat all that stuff by
herself.

<FACE_KLAUS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Congratulations. Your dish looked quite
appetizing. Not surprising, given your skill.

<FACE_KLAUS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Congratulations, <MYNAME>.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>Since you worked so hard, I think it's only fair
that, as your significant other, I give you a
reward. Think of something you'd like, okay?

<FACE_KLAUS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Well done, <MYNAME>. Your unflagging effort
has now borne fruit.
<PAGE>
I'm very proud of you. We should have a
celebration this evening.

<FACE_KLAUS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Well done, <MYNAME>. You may not have won,
but do not let it get to you too much.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>Effort always pays off - if not now, then in the
future. Just think of this as preparation for next
time's victory.

<FACE_KLAUS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Well done, <MYNAME>. You gave it your best. If
you want to take your mind off things, perhaps
we can stop by somewhere on the way home.

<FACE_KLAUS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Well done, <MYNAME>. It's unfortunate you
didn't win, but you gave a rousing effort.
<PAGE>
Is there anything you'd like for dinner tonight? I'll
make whatever you're in the mood for.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>On days like today, there's nothing wrong with
asking for a little pampering. There isn't much
else I could do for you, anyway.

<FACE_KLAUS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
I was rather proud of this dish, yes, but for it to
win? I'm still shocked.

<FACE_KLAUS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Good job today, <MYNAME>. Well? Do you love
me even more now that you know I'm an
excellent cook, in addition to my other talents?
<PAGE>
<FACE_LOVE>Er...I was only joking. You needn't nod so
vigorously.

<FACE_KLAUS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Today, I cooked my dish as if I were going to
serve it to you. That helped me put in the effort
to really make it shine.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>So if my dish was truly that good, think of it as
a representation of my love for you.
<PAGE>
In other words, I wouldn't have won today
without you as my inspiration. Thank you,
<MYNAME>.

<FACE_KLAUS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
It's unfortunate I didn't win, but ah well. Given
my skill, this was about as much as I could have
hoped for, anyway.

<FACE_KLAUS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
I may not have won, but I am still glad that I
was able to compete with you, <MYNAME>.
<PAGE>
I know I will remember it fondly. That in itself
makes today worth it for me.

<FACE_KLAUS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Today was very enjoyable. I'm glad I had the
chance to compete against you.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>I may not have won, but the chance to stand on
the same stage as you is worth far more to me
than a blue ribbon.

<FACE_KLAUS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
All of today's dishes looked quite delicious. Just
looking at them was enough to whet the
appetite.

<FACE_KLAUS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I may not look the part, but I am actually a rather
accomplished cook.
<PAGE>
Following a recipe, measuring out proper
amounts of each ingredient, and adding a
personal touch at the end...
<PAGE>
If one thinks about it like that, cooking is much
the same as making fragrances.

<FACE_KLAUS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
It is nice that our town's Cooking Exhibition
allows contestants to bring dishes they have
already prepared on their own time.
<PAGE>
I hear that in other towns, some contests require
the dishes to be cooked on the spot, so that
speed and technique can also be observed.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LOSS>Full-course meals become a race, as there's no
telling if you can complete all the dishes in the
time allowed.
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL>Hearing that makes me very glad our town's
contest allows for the entry of finished dishes.

<FACE_KLAUS><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
As a professional chef, Raeger is disqualified
from participating. Of course, he would have
been well qualified to be our judge.
<PAGE>
However, he declined, stating that he wasn't
certain he could eat all of the portions required
for judging the full-course entries.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LOSS>I agree -- that would be a great deal of food to
ingest. So where does this slim young lady find
the room to pack away all that food?
<PAGE>
I know she's eating only a few bites of
everything, but that still adds up to a lot of food!

<FACE_REGER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Congrats, <MYNAME>! You should think about
cooking professionally!

<FACE_REGER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LOVE>
Congrats, <MYNAME>. You've gotta be really ace
to take the win like that. I feel like I'm falling in
love all over again.

<FACE_REGER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Congrats. You really put your all into it today. I'm
glad that came through in the results.

<FACE_REGER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
It's too bad you didn't win today. But don't let it
get'cha down. Remember, there'll always be a
next time.

<FACE_REGER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Here, <MYNAME>, say "aaaaah." Tastes pretty
good, huh?
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>That's one of my special, home-made Pick-Me-
Up Sweets. Things didn't turn out how we'd
hoped, but I hope you feel a little better now.

<FACE_REGER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LOSS>
It's too bad you didn't win, but I don't think it
was any kinda shortcoming on your part.
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL>I know better than anyone just how hard you
work at it.
<PAGE>
This time things didn't turn out how we'd hoped,
but you've got me in your corner. I'll help you
out however I can.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>So don't worry. I believe in you, and I think your
cooking can rock the house.

<FACE_REGER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Self won

<FACE_REGER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Self won (Dating)

<FACE_REGER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Self won (Married)

<FACE_REGER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_ANGRY>
Self didn't win

<FACE_REGER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Self didn't win (Dating)

<FACE_REGER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_ANGRY>
Self didn't win (Married)

<FACE_REGER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I'd love to enter, but since I'm a professional
chef, I'm not allowed. Which is probably good, I
guess.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>If I did enter and wound up losing to an
amateur, I'd probably get really depressed.
So...yeah, I'm cool with just watching.

<FACE_REGER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
There isn't much difference in how dishes are
plated, so the most important factor becomes
taste. Basically, is it good quality or not?
<PAGE>
A cook's skill will certainly affect how good a
dish is, but the quality of the ingredients used
will also have a huge impact.
<PAGE>
You could easily say that the biggest battle is
really fought when the cooks are choosing their
ingredients.

<FACE_REGER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Seeing all that food paraded out really is the best
part. Though, it's also pretty impressive seeing
the judge eat all of it all by herself.

<FACE_REGER><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
You may already know this, but when doing full-
course meals, it's best to have some sort of
unifying theme to the whole thing.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LOSS>To give you an example, if you start with Miso
Soup and Spinach Salad, it'd be kinda funny if
you followed it up with a Gratin.
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL>Keeping things all Eastern-themed or all
Western-themed makes the appearance and
tastes more consistent and easier to judge.
<PAGE>
It sounds like a pretty minor thing, but it's
actually really important in the judging.

<FACE_MISTEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Congratulations on your victory. I am glad that
your daily efforts have earned you recognition.

<FACE_MISTEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Congratulations on your victory. However, I hope
you save some of your festive mood for when
the day is done.
<PAGE>
I must admit, I can't help feeling a touch of
pride.

<FACE_MISTEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Congratulations on your victory. I expected no
less from someone as dedicated as you.
<PAGE>
I knew that with the hard work and tireless effort
you put in, you would undoubtedly stand proud
in the winner's circle.

<FACE_MISTEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Thanks to you and everyone else, <MYNAME>, I
had a wonderful time today.

<FACE_MISTEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Results are important, but they don't tell the full
story. It is unfortunate that you did not win this
time...
<PAGE>
But I am sure you have learned some valuable
lessons from the experience. Do not feel too
disheartened.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>Someday, you will benefit from what you
learned today. When that time comes, you will
stand triumphant. Of that I am certain.

<FACE_MISTEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Well done, <MYNAME>. It is unfortunate you
didn't win today.
<PAGE>
But do not let yourself become too disheartened.
Let's just start focusing on next time.
<PAGE>
Let me know if there is anything I can do to
help. I will aid you however I'm able.

<FACE_MISTEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Self won

<FACE_MISTEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Self won (Dating)

<FACE_MISTEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Self won (Married)

<FACE_MISTEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_ANGRY>
Self didn't win

<FACE_MISTEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Self didn't win (Dating)

<FACE_MISTEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_ANGRY>
Self didn't win (Married)

<FACE_MISTEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Hm? I should try out for this contest too? Don't
be absurd. I have no fondness for standing up
on a stage being the center of attention.

<FACE_MISTEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
As it is close to lunchtime, I have noticed many
people who did not eat beforehand staring
longingly at the dishes presented.
<PAGE>
I thought something like this might happen, so I
ate a snack before coming. Now, I know that I
certainly made the right choice.

<FACE_MISTEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
My sister isn't the type to cook often.
<PAGE>
However, she's quite talented, so I'm sure if she
put her mind to it, winning this contest handily
would not be out of the realm of possibility.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>That's IF she chooses to put her mind to it, of
course. My sister can be a bit allergic to "giving
it her all," at times.

<FACE_MISTEL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LOSS>
That lady serving as judge...how deep of a pit IS
her stomach?
<PAGE>
She ate all of that food all by herself, yet she
seems entirely unfazed. I can feel my own
stomach straining, just watching her!

<FACE_NADI><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
You won? Yeah, I saw. Congrats, you made a
good showing today.

<FACE_NADI><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
You won. But then, I knew you could. Great
work.

<FACE_NADI><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Congrats on winning. Kinda expected you
would, anyway, but it's nice to see it happen.
<PAGE>
Given how hard you work every day, how could
you lose? I knew you'd win before the contest
even started.

<FACE_NADI><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
You lost? Yeah, looks like it. No big deal. All
you've gotta do is win next time.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LOSS>What're you staring at me for? Did I say
something weird?
<PAGE>
Just so you know, don't expect any consolation
outta me. If that's what you're looking for, go
ask somebody else.

<FACE_NADI><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
You okay, <MYNAME>?
<PAGE>
<FACE_LOSS>Er, it's nothing. I was just, uh, wondering if you
were feeling down about losing.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LOVE>N-not like I was gonna try to cheer you up or
anything! I'm not good at that stuff. A-anyway,
I'm just glad you're okay.

<FACE_NADI><POS_RIGHT><FACE_ANGRY>
Everything's done, right? C'mon, let's get ready
to go.
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL>Is there anything you wanna have for dinner
tonight? Speak up now, I'm takin' requests.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LOSS>So uh...ahem...can you, um...cheer up? Please?
It doesn't feel right to see you not smiling.

<FACE_NADI><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Self won

<FACE_NADI><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Self won (Dating)

<FACE_NADI><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Self won (Married)

<FACE_NADI><POS_RIGHT><FACE_ANGRY>
Self didn't win

<FACE_NADI><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Self didn't win (Dating)

<FACE_NADI><POS_RIGHT><FACE_ANGRY>
Self didn't win (Married)

<FACE_NADI><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LOSS>
Seeing all that good food made me hungry.
Time to get outta here and grab somethin' to eat.

<FACE_NADI><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
All that food looked really good. How do people
make stuff like that?
<PAGE>
<FACE_LOSS>Even if I followed the exact same recipe, I
guarantee the stuff I made wouldn't turn out
lookin' that good.

<FACE_NADI><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LOSS>
Full-course stuff isn't something you can make
at home real easy, even if you have the time for
it.
<PAGE>
Besides, even if you did manage to make it,
eating all of it before it goes bad is a whole
'nother challenge.

<FACE_NADI><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I'm kinda jealous of people who can cook. I've
never been good at it, myself.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LOSS>Whatever I make, it always winds up feeling like
"bachelor food." I could never manage stuff like
full-course meals.

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Congratulations. Seeing you try so hard today is
inspiring me to work a little harder myself.

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Wow, you won. That's great! Congratulations,
<MYNAME>.
<PAGE>
Looks like I need to step up my game, too.
Maybe when we get home, I'll start
experimenting with new floral arrangements.

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Congratulations, <MYNAME>. We should
celebrate tonight. What do you want for dinner?
I'll make your favorite.

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Good job today. Once the excitement of a
contest winds down, the exhaustion tends to hit
you all at once. You should get home and rest.

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Oh, hey <MYNAME>. Good job today. It's too
bad about you not winning and all, but don't let
it get to you.
<PAGE>
Sure, it'd be nice to come home with that blue
ribbon, but at the end of the day...
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>I think the most important thing is that you
enjoyed yourself."

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Good job today, <MYNAME>. It's too bad you
didn't win, but there's always next time.
<PAGE>
If there's anything I can do to help you prep for
the next contest, just let me know. 
<PAGE>
I love helping you out, no matter what it is. I feel
like I'm always learning something new.

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Self won

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Self won (Dating)

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Self won (Married)

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_ANGRY>
Self didn't win

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Self didn't win (Dating)

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_ANGRY>
Self didn't win (Married)

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LOVE>
All of that food looked so good my stomach
eventually gave in and spoke up. I hope nobody
around me heard it growling.

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LOSS>
I don't mind most of the competition categories,
but I always have such a hard time staying
around for the dessert category.
<PAGE>
<FACE_SAD>The scent of sweets gets so thick in the air, I
feel like I'm gonna get heartburn just from
breathing it.

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
I've never been a big fan of the buffet approach,
with a ton of food slapped down for you to
choose from.
<PAGE>
So full-course meals, with each dish brought
out separately, seems like a really good idea. It
simplifies the pain of having to choose!
<PAGE>
Though I do wish they'd lower the portion size
for each dish. A guy's gotta keep his figure,
y'know.

<FACE_KAMIL><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Miss Saffron, the judge, always speaks in such
plain, easy to understand terms. I'd enjoy
watching her host a cooking show.

<FACE_ELISE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Today, you were lucky. However, a win is a win,
so I will politely offer you my congratulations.

<FACE_ELISE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Congratulations, <MYNAME>. Well done.
<PAGE>
I do not plan on losing to you forever, though. I
will study the intricacies of cooking and one
day, I shall be the victor. Ohohohoho!

<FACE_ELISE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Congratulations, <MYNAME>. You were lucky,
today.
<PAGE>
Ohohohoho! I'm just teasing. You won entirely
on your own merit. I've tasted your cooking,
after all. No one would know that better than I.
<PAGE>
It seems I must practice even harder. We may be
married, but I do hope that we will continue to
challenge each other to achieve greatness.

<FACE_ELISE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
It is a pity you didn't win. Ah well. Do not lose
heart. All you need to do is try harder next time.

<FACE_ELISE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
It's a pity you didn't win. But don't lose heart.
<PAGE>
Even with the same recipe, two different cooks
can make something that tastes completely
different, after all.
<PAGE>
And then there's just blind luck, such as who
ends up being your competition. There's no way
to fully account for that.
<PAGE>
If you allowed yourself to be depressed over
each and every little thing, you'd be a wreck!
Now chin up, and start preparing for next time.

<FACE_ELISE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Well done, <MYNAME>. Hm? Are you feeling
down?
<PAGE>
<FACE_LOSS>It hardly feels right, to see you so down.
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>Well, I guess I shall have to do something about
that! Tonight, I'll make your favorite, so cheer
up, okay?

<FACE_ELISE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Ohohohoho! There is no possible reason why my
cooking would not win. I have been trained by
professional chefs, you know.

<FACE_ELISE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_NORMAL>
Well, <MYNAME>? Have I not improved?
<PAGE>
<FACE_LAUGH>Even though we are courting now...no,
especially because we are together, I want to be
your number one rival.
<PAGE>
Someday, I want you to acknowledge that I am
the superior chef. I think that desire is precisely
what helped me win today.

<FACE_ELISE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LAUGH>
Consider yourself lucky, <MYNAME>. You have
the privilege of eating my prize-winning cooking
every day!
<PAGE>
<FACE_NORMAL>Wh-what...? You consider yourself lucky just to
be with me every day, with or without my
cooking?
<PAGE>
<FACE_LOVE>Wh-what are you doing, saying that where
anyone could hear you?!

<FACE_ELISE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_ANGRY>
I still cannot believe I didn't win. Which aspect
of my presentation was not good enough?

<FACE_ELISE><POS_RIGHT><FACE_LOSS>
It seems I still have much to learn, and not just
about the proper operation of a farm.
<PAGE>
<FACE_SAD>I want to give it my best, but given just how
